name_description: The name of the Redis standalone service
description_description: The description of the Redis standalone service
volume_size_description: The volume size for each cluster's tmp which used as upload cache, recommand at least two times memory size
instance_class_description: The instance type for the cluster to run, such as high performance, high performance plus
count_description: Number of Redis nodes. Failover function only included in 3-nodes version
env_description: Redis service properties. Need fully restart once you made a change to those properties
maxmemory_portion_description: Percentage for Redis maxmemory of instance memory(%)
enable-commands_description: Enable Redis Commands, make sure you know what you are doing.
activerehashing_description: Active rehashing uses 1 millisecond every 100 milliseconds of CPU time in order to help rehashing the main Redis hash table
appendonly_description: The Append Only File is an alternative persistence mode that provides much better durability.
appendfsync_description: It tells the Operating System to actually write data on disk instead of waiting for more data in the output buffer.
hash-max-ziplist-entries_description: Hashes are encoded using a memory efficient data structure when they have a small number of entries
hash-max-ziplist-value_description: Hashes are encoded using a memory efficient data structure when they have a small number of entries
latency-monitor-threshold_description: It samples different operations at runtime in order to collect data related to possible sources of latency of a Redis instance.
list-max-ziplist-entries_description: Small lists are encoded in a special way in order to save a lot of space.
list-max-ziplist-value_description: Small lists are encoded in a special way in order to save a lot of space.
maxclients_description: Set the max number of connected clients at the same time.
requirepass_description: Password for Redis, leave it blank if you don't want authentication, don't use quote sign
maxmemory-policy_description: The eviction policy to remove keys when the memory limit is reached.
maxmemory-samples_description: LRU and minimal TTL algorithms are not precise algorithms but approximated algorithms (in order to save memory), using this to tune it for speed or accuracy.
min-slaves-max-lag_description: A master stops accepting writes if there are less than N slaves connected, having a lag less or equal than M seconds.
min-slaves-to-write_description: A master stops accepting writes if there are less than N slaves connected, having a lag less or equal than M seconds.
no-appendfsync-on-rewrite_description: It prevents fsync() from being called in the main process while a BGSAVE or BGREWRITEAOF is in progress.
notify-keyspace-events_description: It selects the events that Redis will notify among a set of classes.
repl-backlog-ttl_description: It configures the amount of seconds that need to elapse, starting from the time the last slave disconnected, for the backlog buffer to be freed.
set-max-intset-entries_description: It sets the limit in the size of the set in order to use this special memory saving encoding.
slowlog-log-slower-than_description: It logs queries that exceeded a specified execution time.
slowlog-max-len_description: It logs queries with the length of the slow log.
tcp-keepalive_description: TCP keepalive between server and client.
timeout_description: Close the connection after a client is idle for N seconds (0 to disable).
port_description: Port of redis master. range from 1024-65535,default is 6379
zset-max-ziplist-entries_description: Sorted sets are specially encoded in order to save a lot of space.
zset-max-ziplist-value_description: Sorted sets are specially encoded in order to save a lot of space.
lua-time-limit_description: Max execution time of a Lua script in milliseconds. Set it to 0 or a negative value for unlimited execution without warnings.
